headline.print_headline: Mortality Drop Follows Massachusetts Health Law
headline.main: Mortality Drop Seen to Follow ’06 Health Law

docs.abstract: Study published online in the Annals of Internal Medicine finds that the mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, offering what health economists say is evidence that universal coverage has saved lives.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, a study has found, offering evidence that universal coverage has saved lives, health economists say.
docs.snippet: The mortality rate in Massachusetts dropped sharply after the state overhauled health care in 2006, a study has found, offering evidence that universal coverage has saved lives, health economists say.

docs.abstract: What should the F.D.A. do to regulate e-cigarettes, or is it overstepping in treating them like traditional cigarettes?
docs.snippet: What should the F.D.A. do to regulate e-cigarettes, or is it overstepping in treating them like traditional cigarettes?

headline.print_headline: Some E-Cigarettes Deliver a Puff of Carcinogens
headline.main: Some E-Cigarettes Deliver a Puff of Carcinogens

docs.abstract: Study to be published in journal Nicotine and Tobacco Research finds that high-power e-cigarettes known as tank systems produce known carcinogen formaldehyde along with nicotine-laced vapor that their users inhale; second study that is being prepared points to similar findings; research suggests how potential health risks are emerging as multibillion-dollar e-cigarette industry rapidly evolves (Series: The New Smoke).
docs.lead_paragraph: New research suggests that some e-cigarettes get so hot that they can produce a carcinogenic byproduct.
docs.snippet: New research suggests that some e-cigarettes get so hot that they can produce a carcinogenic byproduct.
